page.title: 13POPULATION AND HOUSING.
page.content: The main areas of population are the villages of Wrenbury and Marbury. {WRENBURY}in the north east corner consisted of properties some dating from the 16th century.This small community was enlarged by a sizeable council estate,(circa 1948) a private development mainly bungalows built about 1968 and a modern estate of detached houses post 1980.Infilling has taken place over the years. {MARBURY}in the south west corner is a very small village with a variety of architectural styles of an individual nature covering a wide period. The remaining area is sparsely populated,mainly farms and cottages. {HOUSING SURVEY. {Houses _}Detached 91, Semi_detached 81 Terraced 33.{Bungalows _}Detached 37, Semi_detached 16,Terraced 4.{Farms }20 {Business/House}4.{Public House/Flat}1.
